details.title: IPL auction 2022: Ishan Kishan, Deepak Chahar grab headlines on day one as Indians rule the roost
details.content: Here is the highlights of how the IPL 2022 Mega Auctions went on at day one in Bengaluru. (READ FULL HIGHLIGHTS HERE)

details.title: IN PICS | Ishan Kishan to Deepak Chahar: Check out the full list of players sold in IPL Mega Auction 2022 Day 1
details.content: Here are some of the most expensive Indian and overseas buys of IPL 2022 Mega Auctions so far. (VIEW THE GALLERY HERE)

details.title: IPL 2022 mega auction in numbers: How the ten franchises stack up after day one
details.content: Following is a summarised lowdown of the IPL 2022 mega auction's first day at Bengaluru on Saturday. (READ FULL STORY HERE)

details.title: IPL Explainer: Decoding the whys and why nots of Auction Day 1
details.content: The 10 IPL franchises have so far spent above Rs 388 crore collectively to buy 74 players out of which 20 are overseas recruits. There were 20 players who got more than USD 1 million (Rs 7.53 crore as per Saturday's exchange rates). (READ FULL STORY HERE)

details.title: IPL 2022: Complex auction dynamics in display on day one
details.content: The IPL 2022 auction was always going to be a tough code to crack for franchises this time. And it showed at the end of Day 1 of the auction, the franchises still have plenty of work to do on Sunday in terms of finding a squad balance. With only a limited budget available, it is safe to say not all the franchises will have a good sleep on Saturday night. (READ FULL STORY HERE)

details.title: Day two of IPL 2022 Mega Auction begins
details.content: Stand-in auctioneer Charu Sharma will continue day two procedings as well. Auctioneer Hugh Edmeades, although is fine, won't be taking part in the process anymore.

details.title: Aiden Markram goes to SRH
Rahane goes to Kolkata
Mandeep Singh goes to Lucknow
Quite a few big names fail to find any team as of now
details.content: Cheteshwar Pujara, Aaron Finch, Saurabh Tiwary, Eoin Morgan, Marnus Labuschagne, Dawid Malan all go unsold.

details.title: Liam Livingstone is the first big ticket buy on IPL 2022 Mega Auction day two
Dominic Drakes to play for Gujarat Titans
details.content: The West Indies left-arm seam-bowling allrounder, who appeared for the CPL champion St Kitts, will now play for Gujarat Titans as they buy him for Rs 1.1 crore.

details.title: Jayant Yadav goes to Gujarat
Gujarat snaps up Vijay Shankar
Odean Smith goes to Punjab
Jansen goes to SRH
Shivam Dube to play for CSK
Krishnappa Gowtham goes to Lucknow
How the ten teams stack up so far
details.content:
• Chennai Super Kings: Ruturaj Gaikwad, Ambati Rayudu, Moeen Ali, MS Dhoni, Ravindra Jadeja, Shivam Dube, Deepak Chahar, Dwayne Bravo, Robin Uthappa, KM Asif, Tushar Deshpande [Budget remaining: 16.45 crore]
  • Delhi Capitals: David Warner, Prithvi Shaw, Mitchell Marsh, Rishabh Pant, Sarfaraz Khan, KS Bharat, Mandeep Singh, Axar Patel, Shardul Thakur, Kuldeep Yadav, Anrich Nortje, Kamlesh Nagarkoti, Mustafizur Rahman, Ashwin Hebbar [Budget remaining: 15.40 crore]
  • Gujarat Titans: Shubman Gill, Jason Roy, Abhinav Manohar, Vijay Shankar, Hardik Pandya, Rahul Tewatia, Dominic Drakes, Rashid Khan, Mohammed Shami, Lockie Ferguson, Jayant Yadav, R Sai Kishore, Noor Ahmad [Budget remaining: 14.65 crore]
  • Kolkata Knight Riders: Venkatesh Iyer, Nitish Rana, Shreyas Iyer, Sheldon Jackson, Ajinkya Rahane, Andre Russell, Sunil Narine, Pat Cummins, Shivam Mavi, Varun Chakravarthy [Budget remaining: 11.65 crore]
  • Lucknow Super Giants: KL Rahul, Quinton de Kock, Manish Pandey, Deepak Hooda, Marcus Stoinis, Krunal Pandya, Jason Holder, K Gowtham, Ravi Bishnoi, Avesh Khan, Mark Wood, Ankit Rajpoot [Budget remaining: 6.00 crore]
  • Mumbai Indians: Rohit Sharma, Ishan Kishan, Suryakumar Yadav, Dewald Brevis, Kieron Pollard, Jasprit Bumrah, M Ashwin, Basil Thampi [Budget remaining: 27.85 crore]
  • Punjab Kings: Shikhar Dhawan, Mayank Agarwal, Jonny Bairstow, Liam Livingstone, Jitesh Sharma, Prabhsimran Singh, Odean Smith, Shahrukh Khan, Harpreet Brar, Kagiso Rabada, Rahul Chahar, Arshdeep Singh, Ishan Porel [Budget remaining: 21.15 crore]
  • Rajasthan Royals: Devdutt Padikkal, Yashasvi Jaiswal, Sanju Samson, Jos Buttler, Shimron Hetmyer, Riyan Parag, R Ashwin, Trent Boult, Yuzvendra Chahal, Prasidh Krishna, KC Cariappa [Budget remaining: 12.15 crore]
  • Royal Challengers Bangalore: Faf du Plessis, Virat Kohli, Glenn Maxwell, Anuj Rawat, Dinesh Karthik, Shahbaz Ahmed, Wanindu Hasaranga, Harshal Patel, Josh Hazlewood, Mohammed Siraj, Akash Deep [Budget remaining: 9.25 crore]
  • Sunrisers Hyderabad: Abhishek Sharma, Rahul Tripathi, Kane Williamson, Nicholas Pooran, Aiden Markram, Priyam Garg, Abdul Samad, Washington Sundar, Marco Jansen, Bhuvneshwar Kumar, J Suchith, Shreyas Gopal, Kartik Tyagi, T Natarajan, Umran Malik [Budget remaining: 13.15 crore]

details.title: Two big names go unsold
details.content: Ishant Sharma, Kiwi allrounder Jimi Neesham, Aussie Nathan Coulter-Nile and Proteas pacer Lungi Ngidi fail to find any bidders

details.title: Khaleel Ahmed goes to Delhi
Dushmantha Chameera goes to Lucknow
Chetan Sakariya to play for Delhi
Sandeep Sharma to play for Punjab Kings in IPL 2022
Saini goes to Rajasthan
Mumbai buys Unadkat
Mayank Markande goes to Mumbai
Nadeem to play for Lucknow
CSK gets Maheesh Theekshana
details.content: Sri Lanka's mystery spinner will make his IPL debut for CSK as the latter bags him up for Rs 70 lakhs, after a brief bidding battle with KKR.

details.title: Some experienced spinner go unsold
details.content: Piyush Chawla, Ish Sodhi and Karn Sharma fail to find any teams.

details.title: Rinku Singh goes to KKR
Manan Vohra goes to Lucknow
Latest team list of all the ten franchises
details.content:
• Chennai Super Kings: Ruturaj Gaikwad, Ambati Rayudu, Moeen Ali, MS Dhoni, Ravindra Jadeja, Shivam Dube, Deepak Chahar, Dwayne Bravo, Robin Uthappa, KM Asif, Tushar Deshpande, Maheesh Theekshana [Budget remaining: 15.75 crore]
  • Delhi Capitals: David Warner, Prithvi Shaw, Mitchell Marsh, Rishabh Pant, Sarfaraz Khan, KS Bharat, Mandeep Singh, Axar Patel, Shardul Thakur, Kuldeep Yadav, Anrich Nortje, Kamlesh Nagarkoti, Mustafizur Rahman, Chetan Sakariya, Khaleel Ahmed, Ashwin Hebbar [Budget remaining: 5.95 crore]
  • Gujarat Titans: Shubman Gill, Jason Roy, Abhinav Manohar, Vijay Shankar, Hardik Pandya, Rahul Tewatia, Dominic Drakes, Rashid Khan, Mohammed Shami, Lockie Ferguson, Jayant Yadav, R Sai Kishore, Noor Ahmad [Budget remaining: 14.65 crore]
  • Kolkata Knight Riders: Venkatesh Iyer, Nitish Rana, Shreyas Iyer, Sheldon Jackson, Ajinkya Rahane, Rinku Singh, Andre Russell, Sunil Narine, Pat Cummins, Shivam Mavi, Varun Chakravarthy [Budget remaining: 11.10 crore]
  • Lucknow Super Giants: KL Rahul, Quinton de Kock, Manish Pandey, Deepak Hooda, Marcus Stoinis, Krunal Pandya, Jason Holder, K Gowtham, Ravi Bishnoi, Avesh Khan, Mark Wood, Dushmantha Chameera, Ankit Rajpoot, Shahbaz Nadeem, Manan Vohra [Budget remaining: 3.30 crore]
  • Mumbai Indians: Rohit Sharma, Ishan Kishan, Suryakumar Yadav, Dewald Brevis, Kieron Pollard, Jasprit Bumrah, M Ashwin, Basil Thampi, Jaydev Unadkat, Mayank Markande [Budget remaining: 25.90 crore]
  • Punjab Kings: Shikhar Dhawan, Mayank Agarwal, Jonny Bairstow, Liam Livingstone, Jitesh Sharma, Prabhsimran Singh, Odean Smith, Shahrukh Khan, Harpreet Brar, Kagiso Rabada, Rahul Chahar, Arshdeep Singh, Ishan Porel, Sandeep Sharma [Budget remaining: 10.65 crore]
  • Rajasthan Royals: Devdutt Padikkal, Yashasvi Jaiswal, Sanju Samson, Jos Buttler, Shimron Hetmyer, Riyan Parag, R Ashwin, Trent Boult, Yuzvendra Chahal, Prasidh Krishna, KC Cariappa, Navdeep Saini [Budget remaining: 9.55 crore]
  • Royal Challengers Bangalore: Faf du Plessis, Virat Kohli, Glenn Maxwell, Anuj Rawat, Dinesh Karthik, Shahbaz Ahmed, Wanindu Hasaranga, Harshal Patel, Josh Hazlewood, Mohammed Siraj, Akash Deep [Budget remaining: 9.25 crore]
  • Sunrisers Hyderabad: Abhishek Sharma, Rahul Tripathi, Kane Williamson, Nicholas Pooran, Aiden Markram, Priyam Garg, Abdul Samad, Washington Sundar, Marco Jansen, Bhuvneshwar Kumar, J Suchith, Shreyas Gopal, Kartik Tyagi, T Natarajan, Umran Malik [Budget remaining: 13.35 crore]

details.title: Delhi starts the post-lunch session of day two of IPL 2022 Mega Auctions with a bang
Tilak Verma goes to Mumbai
details.content: Hyderabad batter Tilak Verma to play for Mumbai Indians as the latter buys the uncapped Indian for Rs 1.7 crore, after beating Sunrisers, Rajasthan and CSK in the process.

details.title: Lomror goes to RCB
details.content: The Rajasthan allrounder and big hitter will play for RCB at RS 95 lakh. Rajasthan couldn't keep up with RCB at the bidding battle.

details.title: Kolkata, Gujarat make quick buys
details.content: KKR buys Anukul Roy at Rs 20 lakh. Darshan Nalkande goes to Gujarat Titans at a similar amount.

details.title: Sanjay Yadav goes to Mumbai
details.content: The Tamil Nadu allrounder will now join his team mate Murugan Ashwin at Mumbai Indians in IPL 2022. He played for Nellai Royal Kings at the Tamil Nadu Premier League and can bowl left-arm fingerspin. Mumbai buys him for Rs 50 lakh.

details.title: Raj Bawa goes to Punjab
details.content: The U-19 World Cup winning Indian allrounder will play for Punjab Kings as the latter buys him for Rs 2 crore after bidding wars with Hyderabad and Mumbai.

details.title: U-19 sensation Hangargekar joins CSK
details.content: Rajvardhan Hangargekar, known for his tearaway pace and big hitting down the order, will don the yellow jersey in IPL 2022 as CSK buys him for Rs 1.5 crore.

details.title: Gujarat buys Yash Dayal
details.content: The UP left-arm seamer invoked a sharp bidding war between KKR, RCB and Gujarat Titans. Titans win the war and buy him for Rs 3.2 crore.

details.title: Simarjeet Singh is a Super King now
details.content: The Delhi seamer entered the auction at Rs 20 lakh and CSK, through a late bid, bought him for his base price.

details.title: Fin Allen goes to RCB
details.content: The New Zealand and Wellington Firebirds wicketkeeper-opener will play for RCB Rs 80 lakh. Allen is a quick scorer in powerplay overs and has been in good form in the Super Smash. Rajasthan wanted him but RCB eventually got him.

details.title: Can Conway be the new Mike Hussey for Chennai Super Kings?
Rovman Powell goes to Delhi
Archer goes to Mumbai
Dwaine Pretorius joins CSK
details.content: Chennai now making some strides in the accelerated auction as they buy the Proteas allrounder for Rs 50 lakh.

details.title: Rishi Dhawan goes to Punjab
Mumbai, RCB make some more buys
details.content: Mumbai buys Aussie allrounder Daniel Sams for Rs 2.6 crore. Sherfane Rutherford joins RCB for Rs 1 crore.

details.title: After Conway, now Chennai has Santner
Romario Shepherd goes to Hyderabad
details.content: The Windies and Guyana Amazon Warriors allrounder will feature for Sunrisers Hyderabad for Rs 7.5 crore. Lucknow, CSK, Mumbai, Rajasthan all go for the heavy hitter, but Hyderabad has the final laugh.

details.title: Some big names fail to find bidders at accelerated auction
details.content: Ben McDermott, Glenn Phillips, George Garton, Charith Asalanka, Rassie van der Dussen, Alex Hales, Karun Nair and Evin Lewis all go unsold.

details.title: Jason Behrendorff goes to RCB
details.content: The Aussie left-arm quick enters at Rs 75 lakh and RCB buys him at that price tag.

details.title: Obed McCoy goes to Rajasthan
details.content: The West Indies left-arm seamer will play for Rajasthan Royals at IPL 2022. They buy him for Rs 75 lakh.

details.title: Tymal Mills goes to Mumbai
After Conway and Santner, now CSK gets Milne
Chennai seems a busier lot in the accelerated auction
details.content: Chennai buys uncapped Subhranshu Senapati for Rs 20 lakh.

details.title: Tim David goes to Mumbai
details.content: The Singapore-born Australian batter will now play IPL 2022 for Mumbai Indians at a price tag of Rs 8.25 crore. he has already featured in CPL and PSL. KKR looked good to acquire the services of Singapore-born Australian as they edged past Punjab, Lucknow, Delhi and Rajasthan, but its the Mumbai who has the last laugh. Did they splurge too much cash on an unknown product? Only time will tell.

details.title: Teams make more quick buys to give final shape of their respective group of players
details.content: Suyash Prabhudessai returns to RCB, Saurashtra allrounder Prerak Mankad joins Punjab Kings and Karnataka legspinner Pravin Dubey returns to Delhi.

details.title: Vaibhav Arora goes to Punjab Kings
details.content: Vaibhav Arora, the Himachal pacer, who was at KKR till last year will play for Punjab Kings in IPL 2022. It was a Knights vs Kings duel for the cricketer and punjab snaps him up for Rs 2 crore. Sums up KKR's story so far in IPL 2022 Mega Auctions. Not showing enough intent and planning.

details.title: Some success at last for KKR
details.content: Rasikh Salam Dar joins the franchise for Rs 20 lakh.

details.title: CSK makes one more recruitment
details.content: The Men in Yellow buys Mukesh Choudhary for Rs 20 lakh.

details.title: More quick buys going on
details.content: Karnataka seamer Chama Milind joins RCB, Mohsin Khan joins Lucknow.

details.title: CSK buys Prashant Solanki
details.content: The Mumbai legspinner entered the auction at Rs 20 lakh. After a bidding war with Royals, CSK buys him for Rs 1.2 crore.

details.title: Auction dynamics were very different and challenging this time: Punjab coach Kumble
details.content: Punjab Kings head coach Anil Kumble is extremely satisfied with the new players, including Liam Livingstone and Odean Smith, coming to his franchise during the IPL auction, the dynamics of which were "very different and challenging". (READ FULL STORY HERE)

details.title: Sean Abbott goes to Hyderabad
details.content: The Aussie pacer will play for Sunrisers Hyderabad for Rs 2.40 crore. There was a bidding battle between Delhi, Punjab and Hyderabad, out of which SRH came on top.

details.title: Joseph goes to Gujarat
Meredith comes to Mumbai
details.content: Mumbai continues building on their nice pack of fast bowlers as they pick up the Aussie for Rs 1 crore.

details.title: Bengaluru, Lucknow indulge in quick buys
details.content: Bengaluru snaps up Karnataka batter Aneeshwar Gautam, while Lucknow buys Delhi allrounder Ayush Badoni. Both the players were bought at their base price of Rs 20 lakh.

details.title: Baba Indrajith goes to KKR
details.content: KKR make the only bid for the wicketkeeper-batter from Tamil Nadu and gets him for Rs 20 lakh.

details.title: Chamika Karunaratne goes to KKR
details.content: Base price was Rs 50 lakh. KKR made the opening and only bid for the Sri Lankan allrounder.

details.title: Abhijeet Tomar goes to KKR
details.content: KKR buys its 16th player for Rs 40 lakh. Rajasthan seemed interested in their local batter, before backing out.

details.title: Pradeep Sangwan goes to Titans
details.content: The IPL veteran and former U-19 star will play for Gujarat Titans for Rs 20 lakh.

details.title: Kolkata gathers momentum, Punjab continues its strong show
details.content: KKR buys Pratham Singh for Rs 20 lakh, Punjab snaps up Bengal batsman Writtick Chatterjee for Rs 20 lakh.

details.title: More uncapped players get IPL contracts
details.content: Sunrisers buys Shashank Singh for Rs 20 lakh, Kyle Mayers sold to Lucknow for Rs 50 lakh.

details.title: Lucknow gets one more player
details.content: Lucknow buys Karan Sharma for Rs 20 lakh, its first and only bid.

details.title: Seems like the category of uncapped cricketers is the favourite one for the franchises to reach the quota of 18 players
details.content: Punjab buys Baltej Dhanda, Hyderabad snaps up Saurabh Dubey. Mumbai buys Mohammed Arshad Khan. Punjab gets one more in form of Ansh Patel. All came in their base prices of Rs 20 lakh.

details.title: Ashok Sharma goes to KKR
details.content: After a bidding duel with Rajasthan Royals, KKR takes Sharma home at Rs 55 lakh. His base price was at Rs 20 lakh. They have 18 players, but surely they will go for more, especially at the overseas players' quota. They still have close to Rs 9 crores at their kitty.

details.title: Anunay Singh to goes to Royals
details.content: Rajasthan makes the opening bid of Rs 20 lakh and includes him in their ranks in that price.

details.title: A gentle reminder for those following our coverage
details.content: In the upcoming round,  each franchise to submit names of five to seven cricketers (including the unsold ones) they would still be going after. While some sides have already got the minimum quota of 18 players, the maximum squad strength can reach till 25.

details.title: No Raina in the last round of IPL 2022 Mega Auctions
Miller goes to Gujarat
Sam Billings goes to KKR
Wade goes to Gujarat
Wriddhiman Saha goes to Gujarat Titans
Lungi Ngidi moves to Delhi Capitals
Chris Jordan joins CSK
Alex Hales gets a deal with KKR
Evin Lewis goes to Lucknow
Royals get Karun Nair
Glenn Phillips goes to SRH
details.content: Sunriserrs Hyderabad made the bid for the Kiwi cricketer at Rs 1.5 crore and secures him for that price.

details.title: Tim Seifert moves to Delhi
Punjab, Hyderabad add more players
details.content: Nathan Ellis goes to Punjab Kings for Rs 75 lakh. Punjab also buys Atharva Taide for Rs 20 lakhs. Fazalhaq Farooqi joins SRH for Rs 50 lakh.

details.title: Teams continue their buying spree
details.content: Dhruv Jurel goes to Rajasthan Royals for Rs 20 lakh. Ramandeep Singh joins Mumbai Indians for Rs 20 lakh.

details.title: Bhanuka Rajapaksa goes to Punjab
Tim Southee goes to KKR
Varun Aaron joins Gujarat
More players get contracts for the 2022 season
details.content: English allrounder Benny Howell goes to Punjab Kings for Rs 40 lakh. Rahul Buddhi goes to Mumbai for Rs 20 lakh. Kuldip Yadav goes to Rajasthan for Rs 20 lakh. Ramesh Kumar joins KKR for Rs 20 lakh. CSK keeps Bhagath Varma for Rs 20 Lakh.

details.title: Arjun Tendulkar sold to Mumbai Indians once again
Shubham Garhwal goes to Rajasthan Royals
details.content: RCB got him at a base price of Rs 20 lakhs.

details.title: Another accelerated auction (the last round) is coming. All you need to know
details.content:
• CSK, Punjab Kings have 25 players each. Can't participate in this round. Lucknow Super Giants are out too since they don't have anymore cash. Same goes to Hyderabad who have only 10 lakh left at their kitty, and the minimum base price of the players in this round will be 20 lakh.
  • So it will be only Delhi, Kolkata, Mumbai, Gujarat, Rajasthan and Bangalore in the fray.
  • A total of 12 players will come under the hammer for one final time at IPL 2022 Mega Auctions.

details.title: KKR gets two solid players at their base prices
Royals make some solid buys
RCB makes some good buys
Mumbai also does some business at the final round
Vicky Ostwal goes to Delhi
details.content: They buy the U-19 World Cup 2022 winning spinner for his base price of Rs 20 lakh. And with this, the two-day IPL 2022 Mega Auctions comes to an end.

All the ten franchises now have power-packed squads and none of them can be called an outright favourite to win the championship this year. Still only four of them will make the playoffs, so it will be all about on-field performances and we all have seen in the past that having a solid auction doesn't guarantee a team the 'IPL Champion' status.

This is Prabuddha Ghosh, on behalf of The New Indian Express, signing off. For more news and updates visit newindianexpress.com. Hope you enjoyed our detailed and extensive coverage of the IPL 2022 Mega Auctions.

details.title: How the squads stack up for IPL 2022
details.content:
Chennai Super Kings: Ruturaj Gaikwad, Ambati Rayudu, Moeen Ali, MS Dhoni, Ravindra Jadeja, Shivam Dube, Deepak Chahar, Dwayne Bravo, Robin Uthappa, KM Asif, Tushar Deshpande, Maheesh Theekshana, N Jagadeesan, Hari Nishaanth, Subhranshu Senapati, Mukesh Choudhary, Simarjeet Singh, Rajvardhan Hangargekar, Bhagath Varma, Prashant Solanki, Chris Jordan, Dwaine Pretorius, Devon Conway, Adam Milne, Mitchell Santner.

Delhi Capitals: David Warner, Prithvi Shaw, Mitchell Marsh, Rishabh Pant, Sarfaraz Khan, KS Bharat, Mandeep Singh, Axar Patel, Shardul Thakur, Kuldeep Yadav, Anrich Nortje, Kamlesh Nagarkoti, Mustafizur Rahman, Chetan Sakariya, Khaleel Ahmed, Ashwin Hebbar, Ripal Patel, Yash Dhull, Vicky Ostwal, Lungi Ngidi, Tim Seifert, Praveen Dubey, Rovman Powell, Lalit Yadav.

Gujarat Titans: Shubman Gill, Jason Roy, Wriddhiman Saha, Abhinav Manohar, Vijay Shankar, Hardik Pandya, Rahul Tewatia, Dominic Drakes, Rashid Khan, Mohammed Shami, Lockie Ferguson, Yash Dayal, Jayant Yadav, R Sai Kishore, Noor Ahmad, Alzarri Joseph, Pradeep Sangwan, David Miller, Matthew Wade, Gurkeerat Singh, B Sai Sudharshan.

Kolkata Knight Riders: Venkatesh Iyer, Nitish Rana, Shreyas Iyer, Sheldon Jackson, Ajinkya Rahane, Rinku Singh, Andre Russell, Sunil Narine, Pat Cummins, Shivam Mavi, Varun Chakravarthy, Sam Billings, Anukul Roy, Rasikh Salam, Abhijeet Tomar, Pratham Singh, Aman Khan, Ramesh Kumar, Ashok Sharma, Tim Southee, Alex Hales, Mohammad Nabi, Umesh Yadav, B Indrajith, Chamika Karunaratne.

Lucknow Super Giants: KL Rahul, Quinton de Kock, Manish Pandey, Deepak Hooda, Marcus Stoinis, Krunal Pandya, Jason Holder, K Gowtham, Ravi Bishnoi, Avesh Khan, Mark Wood, Dushmantha Chameera, Ankit Rajpoot, Shahbaz Nadeem, Manan Vohra, Mohsin Khan, Ayush Badoni, Karan Sharma, Mayank Yadav, Kyle Mayers, K Gowtham, Evin Lewis.

Mumbai Indians: Rohit Sharma, Ishan Kishan, Suryakumar Yadav, Dewald Brevis, Kieron Pollard, Jasprit Bumrah, M Ashwin, Basil Thampi, Jaydev Unadkat, Mayank Markande, Sanjay Yadav, Ramandeep Singh, Aryan Juyal, Arjun Tendulkar, Tilak Varma, Hrithik Shokeen, Rahul Buddhi, Arshad Khan, Tymal Mills, Jofra Archer, Fabian Allen, Daniel Sams, Anmolpreet Singh, Tim David, Riley Meredith.

Punjab Kings: Shikhar Dhawan, Mayank Agarwal, Jonny Bairstow, Liam Livingstone, Jitesh Sharma, Prabhsimran Singh, Odean Smith, Shahrukh Khan, Harpreet Brar, Kagiso Rabada, Rahul Chahar, Arshdeep Singh, Ishan Porel, Sandeep Sharma, Atharva Taide, Vaibhav Arora, Ansh Patel, Raj Angad Bawa, Benny Howell, Rishi Dhawan, Bhanuka Rajapaksa, Baltej Singh, Writtick Chatterjee, Nathan Ellis, Prerak Mankad.

Rajasthan Royals: Devdutt Padikkal, Yashasvi Jaiswal, Sanju Samson, Jos Buttler, Shimron Hetmyer, Riyan Parag, R Ashwin, Trent Boult, Yuzvendra Chahal, Prasidh Krishna, KC Cariappa, Navdeep Saini, Tejas Baroka, Anunay Singh, Kuldeep Sen, Dhruv Jurel, Kuldip Yadav, Shubham Garhwal, Nathan Coulter-Nile, Rassie van der Dussen, James Neesham, Daryl Mitchell, Karun Nair, Obed McCoy.

Royal Challengers Bangalore: Faf du Plessis, Virat Kohli, Glenn Maxwell, Anuj Rawat, Dinesh Karthik, Shahbaz Ahmed, Wanindu Hasaranga, Harshal Patel, Josh Hazlewood, Mohammed Siraj, Akash Deep, Suyash Prabhudesai, Luvnith Sisodia, Aneeshwar Gautam, Jason Behrendorff, Karn Sharma, David Willey, Siddarth Kaul, Chama Milind, Mahipal Lomror, Sherfane Rutherford, Finn Allen.

Sunrisers Hyderabad: Abhishek Sharma, Rahul Tripathi, Kane Williamson, Nicholas Pooran, Aiden Markram, Priyam Garg, Abdul Samad, Washington Sundar, Marco Jansen, Bhuvneshwar Kumar, J Suchith, Shreyas Gopal, Kartik Tyagi, T Natarajan, Umran Malik, Saurabh Dubey, Shashank Singh, Sean Abbott, R Samarth, J Suchith, Romario Shepherd, Vishnu Vinod, Glenn Phillips, Fazalhaq Farooqi.
